Because of its expanded perspective, wisdom is also often associated with [[humility]], [[compassion]], [[composure]], and being able to [[laugh]] at oneself.Some [[liberal humanists]] would argue a tolerance for [[dissonance]], [[paradox]], [[nuance]], [[ambiguity]], [[uncertainty]] is also important.
     
In its most universal and useful forms, wisdom tends to sense, work with and align people to the intrinsic [[wholeness]] and [[interconnectedness]] of life.
